body.p: An entity shall determine an accounting policy specifying which expenditures are recognised as exploration and evaluation assets and apply the policy consistently. In making this determination, an entity considers the degree to which the expenditure can be associated with finding specific mineral resources. The following are examples of expenditures that might be included in the initial measurement of exploration and evaluation assets (the list is not exhaustive):

li.p: topographical, geological, geochemical and geophysical studies;
activities in relation to evaluating the technical feasibility and commercial viability of extracting a mineral resource.
